page.title: 05HOUSING IN FERNESS
page.content: The village of Ferness was built as part of the Glenferness Estate and the houses date back to the mid 1800's. The row of cottages included a school/ schoolhouse, shop, shoemakers, smiddy & barber. They are all family houses now. The houses are stone built -2 up and 2 down. Just out of the main part of the village are 7 forestry houses. Originally built & owned by the forestry commission, they are with one exception now privately owned. The other houses in the grid are mostly rented or privately-owned farmhouses.There is no council housing and no new private houses have been built in the last 50-70 years. Many houses once occupied are now derelict or maintained as holiday homes, contributing to the gradual depopulation of the area.
